page.title: 02LOCAL PLACE NAMES
page.content: East Grinstead= Originally Grene stade.1145-Grenestede 1271-Estgrenested 1513-Greynsted.The "East" was an early affix to distinguish the place from West Grinstead.Literally translated,the words mean The Green Place.The town has also been known as Juxta Eadulvebregg-"next to Edenbridge,Kent". Brockhurst-originally Blochest.1255-Brockers 1279-Brockerst 1285- Brokherst."Brock" means "badger" and "hurst" means "wood"-hence "Badgers Wood". Shovelstrode Farm-first similar spelling c1200 with Solvestrode;1257-Scholvestrode.Means "marshy ground by the slope"
